intro: Acronychia reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined acronychia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to northern Australia and parts of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits containing edible seeds. It is often found in coastal and lowland rainforest habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
